body.p: This is a specific schedule for the release of FreeBSD 5.2. For more general information about the release engineering process, please see the Release Engineering section of the web site.
General discussions about the release engineering process or quality assurance issues should be sent to the public FreeBSD-qa mailing list. MFC requests should be sent to re@FreeBSD.org.
FreeBSD 5.2 will continue to be released from the 5-CURRENT development stream. For more details about the milestones for reaching 5-STABLE, see the 5-STABLE Roadmap page.
The current release engineering TODO list is also available. This list is updated periodically through the release cycle.

tr.td: Announce the src/ code freeze for 5.2 on the HEAD branch. Commits to HEAD require re@FreeBSD.org approval.
Announce the ports/ code freeze for 5.2. Commits to ports/ require portmgr@FreeBSD.org approval.
Begin building 5.2-BETA disc1 and disc2 for all Tier-1 platforms.
5.2-BETA tier-1 platform images released and uploaded to ftp-master.FreeBSD.org.
Branch of src/ from HEAD for the release. Note: no branch for RELENG_5 will happen at this time.
Turn off WITNESS, INVARIANTS, and malloc debugging options similar to what was done for 5.1.
Begin building 5.2-RC1 disc1 and disc2 for all Tier-1 platforms.
Unfreeze HEAD src. Continue to coordinate significant check-ins with re@FreeBSD.org in order to work towards 5-STABLE.
5.2-RC1 tier-1 platform images released and uploaded to ftp-master.FreeBSD.org.
Tentative date of RELEASE_5_2_0 tag for ports.
Announce the doc/ slush for 5.2. From this time until the tagging of the doc/ tree, non-critical changes should be postponed to allow translation teams time to finish their work for the release.
Begin building 5.2-RC2 disc1 and disc2 for all Tier-1 platforms.
5.2-RC2 tier-1 platform images released and uploaded to ftp-master.FreeBSD.org.
Tag the doc/ tree with RELEASE_5_2_0.
The files listed here are updated to reflect FreeBSD 5.2.
Tag the RELENG_5_2 branch with RELENG_5_2_0_RELEASE.
Heads up email to mirror-announce@FreeBSD.org to give admins time to prepare for the load spike to come. The site administrators have frequently requested advance notice for new ISOs.
Release and packages uploaded to ftp-master.FreeBSD.org.
FreeBSD 5.2 is announced to the mailing lists.
A formal press release statement is in the works and should be released at this time to the www.FreeBSD.org website and various tech publications.
